definition: (archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: Unless you have ulterior motives, the facts will open your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 除非你居心不良，否則那裏的真相會讓你大開眼界。

sentences.english: Niger's Information Minister said the UN officials were ill-intentioned.
sentences.chinese: 尼日爾信息部長稱，聯合國官員居心不良。

sentences.english: Chou his one eye, she tiny Du next jaws, with bad purpose.
sentences.chinese: 瞅了他一眼，她微嘟了下嘴，居心不良。

sentences.english: Scaramouche, scaramouche will you do the fandango.
sentences.chinese: 侯爵，侯爵將你的居心不良。

definition: see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to have an axe to grind (idiom)
to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to start rumours and create trouble
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
